title: Serve DLNA lists only images on Android
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
If I start a DLNA server with rclone serve dlna myremote: on Android (with Termux), it only lists image files inside the folders, and I can't see any other filetype. I tried with a lot of DLNA clients with the same results, and using the same command from Linux (Fedora 64 bit) works fine.



#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
1.48.0 and 1.48.0-DEV (I tried with the Termux rclone package, with the official one built from source and with the official one built from the fix-dlna branch, with the same results).


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Android 9 (Pie) 64 bit


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone serve dlna Drive-crypted:


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

<details>
<summary>Using the rclone package from termux or the official one built from source:</summary>
$ rclone serve -vv dlna Drive-crypted:
